section.name: Overview
section.p: The display tag library is an open source suite of custom tags that provide high-level web presentation patterns which will work in an MVC model. The library provides a significant amount of functionality while still being easy to use.

p.p: Problems and wishes reported against the previous display tag release are now tracked in the Displaytag Jira Tracker at Codehaus.
Current development is focused on removing limitations and design flaws.

ul.li: Do you want to add a new export type? You can now do that, it is configurable! And, a PDF export sample has also been added.
Do you want to easily i18n display tag properties? Yes, display tag will support it, and you also can configure the way the locale is choosen.
Do you want to use i18n in column titles in the non-EL version of the taglib, or use an i18n support other than JSTL? You will be free to plug-in your own I18nResourceProvider!

p.p:
A roadmap
where issues are scheduled and prioritized is available on JIRA. Login is required. You are free to create an account.

p.strong: This documentation corresponds to the latest development snapshot (unreleased version). Refer to the documentation included in your download if you are using a previous release.

section.name: What can I do with it?
section.p: Actually the display tag library can just... display tables! Give it a list of objects and it will handle column display, sorting, paging, cropping, grouping, exporting, smart linking and decoration of a table in a customizable XHTML style.
